name: String = Vertex list
description:
Your task here is to create a program which parses a given string (presumably a 3D object) into an array of vertices.

Example:

```
v 1.00 -1.00 -1.00
v 1.00 1.00 -1.00
v 1.00 -1.00 1.00
v 1.00 1.00 1.00
v -1.00 -1.00 -1.00
v -1.00 1.00 -1.00
v -1.00 -1.00 1.00
v -1.00 1.00 1.00
f 0/1/2
f 2/3/0
f 4/5/6
f 6/7/0
```

The layout is very similar to the layout of a standard *.obj* 3D model. 
The proper output for this *string* is:
```
{
  { 1.00, -1.00, -1.00 },
  { 1.00,  1.00, -1.00 },
  { 1.00, -1.00,  1.00 },
  { 1.00, -1.00,  1.00 },
  { 1.00,  1.00,  1.00 },
  { 1.00, -1.00, -1.00 },
  {-1.00, -1.00, -1.00 },
  {-1.00,  1.00, -1.00 },
  {-1.00, -1.00,  1.00 },
  {-1.00, -1.00,  1.00 },
  {-1.00,  1.00,  1.00 },
  {-1.00, -1.00, -1.00 },
}
```

The indices, however, can have different lenghts every line, unlike an *obj* file. 
Even though the length is unknown, the indices are unsigned. Meaning they will never go under 0.

On the other hand, if the index exceeds the length of the vertices, there are no vertecies or there are no indices at all, you will return ``nullptr``.

How you parse the string is up to you.

As a last thing, you have to modify the value inside ``count`` with the amount of vertices inside your array.
